// ---------- 0x04 RSSI Acceptance level

[M 0x04 MIN_MAX]
160 255

[M 0x04 NAME]
RSSI acceptance level

[M 0x04 HINT]
Minimum RSSI level to accept network connection
Default value 255 automatically sets value corresponding to selected RF bit rate 


Min: 160
Max: 255
Default: 193 or 255 (From FW V 1.44)

Confer data sheet for RSSI sensitivity information.
Recommended RSSI Acceptance Levels for given RF Bit Rates:

RF Data Rate                       1     2     3     4     5     6     7     8
RSSI Acceptance Level    208 200 196 190 186 182 178 188

Default value 255 provides auto selection to corresponding 
RF bit rate from Firmware Version 1.44 forward

// ---------- 0x0A Max Jumps
[M 0x0A MIN_MAX]
5 100

[M 0x0A NAME]
Maximum Jump Count

[M 0x0A HINT]
Maximum transportation jumps before a packet
is considered undeliverable, and eliminated.

Min:	    5
Max:	100
Default:    30
[]

// ---------- 0x0B Max delay
[M 0x0B MIN_MAX]
1 255

[M 0x0B NAME]
Maximum packet latency

[M 0x0B HINT]
Maximum transport time before a packet
is judged as undeliverable, and eliminated.

Calculated as:
Periods of 2.55s if Max Latency Time Base= 1 
Periods of 10ms if Max Latency Time Base= 0

Max Latency Time Base	1       	(0)
Min:	    1 =          	2.55s	(10ms)
Max:	  255 =           	653s	(2.550s) 
Default:    50 =            	125s	(0.5s)
[]


// ---------- 0x0C / 12 TX_Retry
[M 0x0C MIN_MAX]
1 200

[M 0x0C NAME]
RF Transmit retry limit

[M 0x0C HINT]
Number of unsuccessful transmit retries to same recepient
before a Router or End node disconnects and attempts 
reconnecting to an alternate recipient in the network. 

Min:	    5
Max:	200
Default:   100     	
[]

// ---------- 0x0D Serial Port Timeout
[M 0x0D MIN_MAX]
1 255

[M 0x0D NAME]
Serial port Time Out

[M 0x0D HINT]
Time out between character inputs to the serial port before a 
packet is formed and transmitted from a Router or End Device, 
or Gateway in Transparent mode.
Gateway in Packet mode will evaluate received data as a formatted 
Command- or Serial out packet.

Time is calculated as periods of 1 ms

Min:	    1 
Max:	255 	
Default:    20 
[]

CTS Hold Time in 10ms periods.

Too much data traffic from the Gateway may overload the network, causing temporary disconnects.

Max:	255

// ---------- 0x3A / 58UART FLOW CONTROL

[M 0x3A MIN_MAX]
1 127

[M 0x3A NAME]
UART Flow Control

[M 0x3A HINT]
UART Flow Control Selection Bitmap:
Bit 0 (Bit value 1): CTS Output enable (Always 1)
Bit 1 (Bit value 2): Gateway RTS Input enable
Bit 2 (Bit value 4): RXTX direction control Output enable (RS485 protocol) 
Bit 3 (Bit value 8): Xon Xoff protocol enable
Bit 4 (Bit value 16): Gateway Ack / NAK protocol enable
Bit 5 (Bit value 32): Gateway Wait For Ack protocol enable
Bit 6 (Bit value 64): Gateway Packet CRC enable

Add bit values to set desired combination.

Example:
1   : CTS Output (Default)
3   : CTS + RTS
4   : RXTX (RS485 control)
9   : CTS + Xon/ Xoff 
17 : CTS + Gateway ACK / NAK
19 : CTS + RTS + Gateway ACK / NAK
33 : CTS + Gateway waits for Host ACK
35 : CTS + RTS + Gateway waits for Host ACK
49 : CTS + Gateway ACK / NAK+ Gateway waits for Host ACK
51 : CTS + RTS + Gateway ACK / NAK + Gateway waits for Host ACK
65 : CTS output + packet CRC
81 : CTS output + Ack / NAK protocol + packet CRC 
[]

[C 0x05 NAME]
Flash Erase Delay

[C 0x05 MIN_MAX]
0 255

[C 0x05 DEF]
255

[C 0x05 HINT]
Delay time from ‘M’

command initiated in
Configuration Mode,
until the Flash Erase
procedure is initiated.

Delayed Flash Erase will limit
possibility of failed flash write
in systems with external MCU
that performs flash
configuration at Power On
Reset, under conditions where
Reset Input may bounce from

unstable or noisy conditions.
